issue.title: Gas Emitter Location in Urban Qual

content.raw:
I updated the artifact detector to also include gas emitters and vents with this pull request: [#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/365](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/365)

If it is helpful, I also have a small prototype visual plugin for rviz for seeing the current state of the gas sensor: [https://github.com/mjcarroll/subt\_rviz\_plugins](https://github.com/mjcarroll/subt_rviz_plugins)

It will turn red when gas is detected.  \(Note that the animation is from a test environment and doesn’t reflect where an emitter would actually be in the urban environment\)

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/88899444-gas_plugin.gif)
‌
content.html:
I updated the artifact detector to also include gas emitters and vents with this pull request: #!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/365

If it is helpful, I also have a small prototype visual plugin for rviz for seeing the current state of the gas sensor: https://github.com/mjcarroll/subt_rviz_plugins

It will turn red when gas is detected. (Note that the animation is from a test environment and doesn’t reflect where an emitter would actually be in the urban environment)
